features: 🎻 Micro building blocks: this musical instrument building block is a miniature building block. Note: not suitable for children under 6 years old. Parent supervision is required all the time.
🎷 Independent packaging: Each musical instrument is individually packaged, with detailed and easy-to-understand instructions.

🎸 Exquisite craftsmanship: This set of music prizes for students include a bass, an accordion, an electronic organ, a violin, a harp, a guitar, a saxophone, a xylophone and its mallets, an oboe, a jazz drum, a bass drum, and a horn.
🎺 Excellent quality: the micro blocks are made of high-quality ABS plastic 100% non-toxic and completely safe for children.

🎹 FUN GIFTS: Great as music party favors for kids' Easter parties, Easter egg fillers, sock fillers, gift bag fillers, cake toppers, carnival prizes, and more! Kids will love their creations and share their work with their friends.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.3 4.3 out of 5 stars 3,473 ratings 4.3 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: These were really fun to put together as a family. Every year for Christmas, I try to find something fun to put together with family. Most of them have very tiny pieces, so it wouldn't be good for small kids and it was a struggle for my elderly MIL to put together. Also, some of the pieces don't stay together, but overall it was a blast to do them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome Party Favor!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased these as party favors for an adult church choir party. I was so pleased to see that each instrument came in it's own little box which made them perfect for gift giving. Yes, the pieces are very tiny, but the effect was perfect! They were super entertaining simply because they were so tiny. Quality was not missing because of the size. The group had a wonderful time taking them home, putting them together (or having a younger person do it for them) and bringing them back to church and placing them one by one on the organ. I highly recommend. We have had so much fun with them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fun Building Block Set, Though Quite Small
reviews.reviewText: We got this set to add to a 'goodie' bag for my daughter's upcoming birthday gathering. We usually add a few fun things in a bag for the kids that join us and at less than $2 a set this looked like a nice option. The sets are very attractive and the kids enjoyed building them. I kept one for me and found it fun. :-) These are what is known as micro building block, so about 10%-20% the size of the larger name brand ones. Each set was around 100 pieces to build and included a decent number of extra pieces. The finished models are about 2" tall and well detailed for the small size. The directions can be a little tricky as most steps are showing two phases of building and I needed to refer to the box image a couple times to make sure I was on track. That said, if the builder is familiar with Lego, Mega Bloks of any of the other name brand building block sets this should be doable. Out of a group of 5 kids, only one didn't enjoy them and she rarely builds block based models. All in all, this is a fun set to gift or just enjoy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: We use these to keep our students occupied while waiting at our Tutor Center (--instead of their video devices). Each model comes in its own box with instructions. The instructions are a little hard to follow, but the kids just look at the pictures and figure it out. We've ordered both animal sets and the music set. The music set is more advanced, but the 5th graders and older can do them. 1st graders and older can do the animal sets.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun to build but more difficult than your typically "Lego"
reviews.reviewText: These were fun yet tough to assemble. The pieces are tiny compared to a standard lego. They don't fit as well as I'd like but the variety of sets still make it a worthwhile buy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars More frustrating than fun
reviews.reviewText: Instructions are absolutely abysmal. It's like they wanted to keep it to one side of one piece of paper and then did the instructions accordingly. The pieces are so small that if you mess up (because the instructions suck), it's really difficult to take them apart. It's a neat idea but the execution leaves A LOT to be desired.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I gave these as Christmas dinner party favors to our great nephews and they enjoyed them. They were a perfect price for a party favor and looked much nicer than they cost.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Tiny tiny pieces
reviews.reviewText: I was so excited to give this in my son's birthday as part of the goody bags. It was so disappointing. The pieces are super tiny and the instructions are so hard to understand even for an adult. Waist of money!

I bought these to check them out as student gifts and ended up enjoying them so much I made them all and have decided to keep them haha. They are not for tiny fingers and would need parental help for young kids but say 8 yo up they would be able to do it.The only complaint I have is they are very different scales so when I set it up the trumpet towers over the keyboard
Fantastic little gift for gift bags. Something useful for today's kids. Create and display !
